events.message: The insured reported a minor car collision with another vehicle at an intersection, initiating the claim process.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident due to collision involving the insured's vehicle and another car.
A claims agent was assigned to this case and reached out to the claimant to gather additional details.
The insured was informed that the claim has been acknowledged and the investigation would begin shortly.
Requested photos of the damage to the insured's vehicle and the police accident report for further processing.
Received all requested documents including vehicle damage photos and official police accident report from the claimant.
The claim was assigned to the investigation unit to verify accident details and liability between involved parties.
Investigation concluded that the claimant is not at fault and the damage estimates were verified with the repair shop.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling of the case.
Management approved the settlement after verifying all documents and investigation results for final payout.
The payment covering vehicle repair costs and mileage reimbursement was issued to the claimant's bank account.
Claim case was officially closed after confirming payment receipt and repair completion by the insured.
All claim files and related documentation were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
